title: Metrics
description: This is map of metrics and measures. Each key is the valid URI of a known `Metric`. Each value is a `Measure`, i.e. a concrete data point.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/co.description: A product-list has been identified as no longer accessible (e.g purchasable) by the user.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/di.description: Asynchronous message(s) that have been returned as temporarily undeliverable the receiving system.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/co.description: An action during a checkout process of a product-list, there can be more than one checkout event if there are multiple steps in a checkout process. If there are multiple steps the event time information and referenced page or experience is used to identify the step individual events represent in order.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/ad.description: A digital video ad has played through it's entirety.
A pre-defined action on a website triggered a conversion event to be fired

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/ap.description: Triggered when the application does not exit gracefully. Event is sent on application launch after a crash.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/ad.description: A digital video ad has played through 25% of it's duration at normal speed.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/ap.description: Activation(s) of an application feature that is being measured.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/ad.description: Impression(s) of an advertisement to an end user with the potential of being viewed.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/ap.description: Install of an application on a device. Triggered on first launch after install.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/ad.description: Impression(s) of an advertisement to an end user with viewablility library instrumented.
Indicator of ad not being visible as measured by a viewability library at impression time.
Indicator of ad being muted as measured by a viewability library at impression time.
Indicator of ad being displayed in an inactive window as measured by a viewability library at impression time.
Indicator of viewability library not being able to properly execute measurements due to ad being displayed inside an iframe.
Indicator of viewability library not being able to properly execute measurements due to non-predefined error.
Completion(s) of an advertisement to an end user deemed viewable at completion time by a viewability library.
First quartile(s) of an advertisement to an end user deemed viewable at first quartile of play by a viewability library.
Midpoint(s) of an advertisement to an end user deemed viewable at midpoint of play by a viewability library.
Third quartile(s) of an advertisement to an end user deemed viewable at third quartile of play by a viewability library.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/we.description: Click of a web-link has occurred.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/ap.description: Launch of an application. Triggered on every run, including crashes and installs. Also triggered on a resume from background when the lifecycle session timeout has been exceeded.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/ad.description: A digital video ad has played through 50% of it's duration at normal speed.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/di.description: Click on a link in a message to a web hosted mirror page.
Asynchronous message(s) failed to deliver in a way that indicates that no future delivery attempts will be successful to the address.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/we.description: View(s) of a webpage has occurred.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/co.description: Addition of a product to the product-list. Example a product is added to a shopping cart.
Initializations of a new product-list. Example a shopping cart is created.
Removal(s) of a product entry from a product-list. Example a product is removed from a shopping cart.
A product-list that was no longer accessible(abandoned) has been re-activated by the user. Example via a re-marketing activity.
View(s) of a product-list has occurred.
View(s) of a product have occurred.
An order has been accepted. Purchase is the only required action in a commerce conversion. Purchase must have a product-list referenced.
Product-list is saved for future use. Example a product wish list.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/di.description: Asynchronous message(s) (email, SMS, MMS etc) have been dispatched to a person's account/address/device.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/ad.description: A digital video ad has started playing.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/ap.description: Upgrade of an application that has previously been installed. Triggered on first launch after upgrade.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/di.description: User complaint(s) have been received. This generally occurs when a recipient of a message reports it as spam.
The direct marketing message (email, SMS, Push Notifications etc) has been opened/swyped/touched by the recipient.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/ad.description: A digital video ad has played through 75% of it's duration at normal speed.

https://ns.adobe.com/xdm/data/metrics/di.description: The recipient of the direct marketing message (email, newsletters, etc) has opted out from receiving them.
Asynchronous message (email, SMS, MMS etc) was not dispatched due to cancellation or expiration of the marketing activity.
